steps.title: Choose an oversized windbreaker for a fashion-forward look.
steps.content: Choose an oversized windbreaker for a fashion-forward look. Windbreakers used to be a form-fitting way to stay protected from the wind. In fashion, they are now used as oversized statement pieces that add style and class to an outfit. Purchase a baggy, oversized windbreaker to elevate your style. Buy one as large as you are comfortable with. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Keep your windbreaker fitted for a sporty style.
steps.content: Keep your windbreaker fitted for a sporty style. If you are using your windbreaker to run or exercise in, consider getting one that is actually your size. This will be easier to move in and it will also give you a more athletic vibe. Make sure the windbreaker hits at your hips and the sleeves end just above your wrists. [2] X Research source This will also allow you to wear your windbreaker in more professional settings.

steps.title: Be bold with a multi-colored windbreaker.
steps.content: Be bold with a multi-colored windbreaker. Many windbreakers call back to the 80s and 90s in terms of color and style. Choose a windbreaker with multiple blocks of color to stand out and make a statement with your windbreaker. Multi-colored windbreakers look great over a monochromatic outfit, like all black. [3] X Research source Bright colors in large chunks are more vintage than modern.

steps.title: Stay classic with a solid-colored windbreaker.
steps.content: Stay classic with a solid-colored windbreaker. Windbreakers that are a solid color are an excellent staple for any closet. An all-black windbreaker will go well with almost anything, but you can choose a windbreaker of any color that you like. If you are feeling daring, you can even try a bright neon colored windbreaker. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wear a windbreaker with a hood for utility.
steps.content: Wear a windbreaker with a hood for utility. If you live in an area that has a lot of rain, you may need to choose a windbreaker with slightly more coverage than normal. Buy a windbreaker that has a hood on it so that you can not only wear it fashionably but also get some functionality out of it. Try to find one where you can tuck the hood into the collar of the jacket for more versatility. [5] X Research source Classic windbreakers do not usually have hoods on them, but you can find modern ones that do.

steps.title: Pair your windbreaker with high-waisted jeans for a vintage look.
steps.content: Pair your windbreaker with high-waisted jeans for a vintage look. If you have a bright, blocky-colored windbreaker, you are already calling back to the decades before. To play up this look, add a pair of light-wash high-waisted jeans. Make sure your jeans fit you well in the waist and hips, but are loose around the calves and ankles. [6] X Research source You can find jeans like this at most thrift stores.

steps.title: Wear black jeans to make your windbreaker stand out.
steps.content: Wear black jeans to make your windbreaker stand out. If you want your windbreaker to be the main focus of your outfit, tone down the rest of your look by wearing simple black jeans. [7] X Expert Source Kalee Hewlett Image Consultant Expert Interview. 20 April 2021. This will make your windbreaker pop so that it draws attention. This is a great idea for brightly-colored and oversized windbreakers. [8] X Research source You can also wear black jeans with a black windbreaker for a streetwear look.

steps.title: Look sporty with some skin-tight leggings or workout pants.
steps.content: Look sporty with some skin-tight leggings or workout pants. If you are wearing your windbreaker to work out or you want to create an athleisure look, wear some leggings or workout pants with your windbreaker. This makes you look ready to move your body while also being fashion-forward. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Wear your windbreaker with slacks for a business casual look.
steps.content: Wear your windbreaker with slacks for a business casual look. If you’re heading into the office but you still want to be comfortable, throw on your windbreaker over your button-down shirt. Pair it with some slacks or dark-wash jeans and some dress shoes and you are set to do work with an athleisure vibe. [10] X Research source If your office is particularly formal, a windbreaker is not a good choice.

steps.title: Put on a form-fitting skirt for a chic outfit.
steps.content: Put on a form-fitting skirt for a chic outfit. If you want to dress up your windbreaker, wear it over a form-fitting skirt or dress to elevate your look. Match your skirt color to your windbreaker color for a monochromatic outfit, or pair a dark dress or skirt with a bright windbreaker to stand out. You can even add a pair of slim high heels to complete this outfit. [11] X Research source Loose fitting skirts and dresses, like A-lines, do not go well with windbreakers. Stick with form-fitting ones to even out your look.

steps.title: Put on a classic T-shirt to keep it simple.
steps.content: Put on a classic T-shirt to keep it simple. Windbreakers are often the main focus of an outfit. To keep it that way, throw on a classic, neutral colored T-shirt that fits you well. White T-shirts are always a good choice, especially with light-wash jeans. Black T-shirts pair well with darker jeans and will emphasize the colors in your windbreaker. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Make your outfit more formal with a button-down or blouse.
steps.content: Make your outfit more formal with a button-down or blouse. It can be fun to dress up a windbreaker sometimes, whether you are headed to the office or just want to parody business attire. Throw on a button-down or blouse underneath of your windbreaker for a cool juxtaposition of style. [13] X Research source If you want the popped collar look without all the buttons, try a polo shirt instead of a button-down.

steps.title: Leave your windbreaker unzipped to show off your shirt underneath.
steps.content: Leave your windbreaker unzipped to show off your shirt underneath. If the day isn’t particularly windy or you really want to show off your shirt, leave your windbreaker fully or partially unzipped so people can see your entire outfit. This is especially helpful when you are doing a monochromatic look, like an all black outfit with a pop of color in your windbreaker. [14] X Research source Some windbreakers don’t have zippers, in which case you can wear whatever shirt you want underneath of them.

steps.title: Add a large leather belt for a vintage outfit.
steps.content: Add a large leather belt for a vintage outfit. If you are wearing a windbreaker from the 80s, you might want to play up that look by adding other pieces from that era. Use a thick leather belt to buckle your jeans and add to your outfit. Tuck the front of your windbreaker into your pants or leave it unzipped to show off your belt. [15] X Research source Black belts look the best on light-wash, loose fitting jeans.

steps.title: Wear chunky sneakers to balance out your look.
steps.content: Wear chunky sneakers to balance out your look. A loose-fitting windbreaker goes great with some chunky, large shoes. Slip on some sneakers that make your feet look slightly wider than they actually are to balance out your outfit. Keep your bottoms slick with some skinny jeans, or play up the oversized look with a relaxed fitting pair of pants. [16] X Research source White shoes will make light-wash jeans pop.

steps.title: Stick with running shoes to match the sporty vibe of the windbreaker.
steps.content: Stick with running shoes to match the sporty vibe of the windbreaker. If you have leggings or workout pants on, throw on some running shoes to compliment the sporty vibe you have going on. You can also wear running shoes with cuffed jeans for a streetwear look. Keep your running shoes a neutral color to make your windbreaker stand out. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Keep your outfit casual with a backpack or fanny pack.
steps.content: Keep your outfit casual with a backpack or fanny pack. A purse or a handbag can elevate an outfit, so keep it casual by throwing your essentials into a small backpack or a fanny pack. A fanny pack will play on the windbreaker’s vintage sporty look, while the backpack keeps your outfit looking utilitarian. Match your backpack or fanny pack to your windbreaker, or use one that is a solid color so it doesn’t stand out. [18] X Research source
